reviews.text: Checked in. Very nice. Got up to our hotel room. Apparently the fridge is not a fridge. Just a cooler now. They've stopped using as a fridge. None of the Keurig or the kettle were plugged in. We plugged it in. Room is nice. Very spacious. Bed is nice and big.  TV has lots of channels to watch TV. If you're in your hotel room for long enough, lots of on demand movies that cost you about $20 a piece, but that's okay

Nice renovated property with amenities including gym, sauna, jacuzzi and swimming pool. The rooms are modern and spacious, corridors and lift halls clean and well maintained.
The lobby is spacious, well lit with plenty of seating space. Staff at front desk was courteous and helpful. Lobby bar and Courtyard bar staff was also friendly and knowledgeable about activities within the hotel vicinity.
Hotel is within walking distance to White House and short ride to mall and other monuments. Public transports and taxis are available on the doorstep. Street parking is also available in addition to plenty of parking garages.
Breakfast buffet could have more variety.
Overall, a very pleasant experience.

We were underwhelmed.  We attended the Christmas Day brunch and stayed overnight for Christmas.  The brunch service was excellent and the staff were extremely attentive and accommodating.  The food was OK, but we did not expect much more for a buffet.
The room, however, was disappointing.  The air quality was poor and the thermostat could not be set to adjust the temperature in the room.  We woke congested and unable to breathe; there was also a rank odor in the room that smelled like a wet dog🥺  We called and asked for a manager but no one ever called back.  We complained at check out, but little was done about the matter.  The front desk seemed indifferent.  None of the soaps in the bathroom had been replenished in the shower.  We expected a bit more for a 4 star hotel.  Not sure we would stay again…as locals, we love to explore hotels and provide details of our journeys.  We would stick to the Four Seasons Georgetown as our top recommendation, as this was more of a 2/3 star experience.

Nice property, good venue for a conference. Rooms are very nice and the staff is friendly and attentive. My only knock is the wifi network is pretty bad. It was difficult to participate in Teams calls. Everything else was great - especially if you need to be in the Georgetown area.

Pathetic staff and Managers. There were so many issues since we arrive at this hotel but we ignored them and checked out. They charged us twice for the same stay. We reached out to the hotel with all details to refund the amount they charged without our authorization on August 24, 2022, and followed up several times via email. No one has come back to us yet. I am posting this review in hope that they will reach out to me and process a refund. It's been more than 15 days now.

Excellent! The front desk staff, valet, and housekeepers were all extremely friendly and accommodating. My wife, dog and I recently stayed 4 nights and had a great time. Hotel was Very clean, spacious and modern. The balcony room is a must have in my opinion and it didn’t disappoint. The area is really nice and has plenty of walkable spots for food, coffee, etc. Firefly has an eclectic brunch menu and they have great bar tenders as well. The only negative I could possibly share would be the water pressure but with multiple settings for the shower it was fine. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to have an amazing guest experience with a high standard for cleanliness in the nation’s capital.

The minute we walked in the staff’s energy was amazing - we were able to check in very early and upgrade to a larger room which was so comfortable for the 3 of us. I’m in real estate and my friends live in beautiful homes so I had to get the hotel right and I did! this space was stylish, sleek and well equipped.. The robes warmed us nicely along with the electric pot to make our coffee and tea. Just lovely we will certainly let come back and stay at Madera. the restaurant had a delicious brunch we enjoyed as well- this made our DC weekend wonderful

My son and I really enjoyed our stay here, everyone is so sweet . The hotel is absolutely beautiful and it has a very nice restaurant on premises.  I really have to give a big shout out to the manager  Maggie  is the most sweetest person ever. She made me feel so special and important.  Please please keep her, I will definitely come back to visit. Thank you so much for an amazing experience.  I highly recommend.

The location is amazing, near restaurants, cafes, Subway and the neighborhood is beautiful. The rooms are very comfortable, large and the balconies are great.  The restaurant on the first floor has great breakfast and the staff is by far the nicest I have ever experience besides my recent stay in at the intercontinental in Cali Colombia. Kudos to the amazing staff they do a fantastic job. Especial thanks to ICE at the front desk.  When we go back to DC we will stay @ hotel Madeira for sure.

I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Madera. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was very clean. I stayed in the King Studio with balcony and the room was very spacious. The room included a large sectional couch and it was very comfy. I also enjoyed the shower because it was very roomy and also had a handheld shower head sprayer. The water in the shower got very hot easily. The room also included a tea kettle to heat water for hot beverages.

We had a fabulous experience here. It's a very fun atmosphere and the food was delicious. I had the crazy corn chicken salad and it might be my most favorite salad ever. My husband had the southwest chicken salad and my daughter had the chicken and waffles. Everyone enjoyed their meal. Our waitress, Camilla, was fantastic and has a great personality. Everyone working there seemed like they were having a good time.

Quality food and drinks!  Stopped by while out and about visiting DC with the family.  Short walk from several metro stations.  Reserved a table during lunchtime the morning we went and was seated minutes after we showed up.  Staff was attentive and my drink was never empty.  Reasonable prices for the quality food you get considering the location and love the bar menu.  Was recommended this place by several people and it was quickly apparent why.  Will definitely visit again next time we are in DC!

Really fresh, delicious breakfast! We tried the waffle, pancake, and egg scramble. Obviously made in house - really delicious. Pancakes and waffles were exceptional. Egg scramble was very savory. The coffee is way better than your average breakfast place. Service was quick and friendly. Recommended!

What a gem! The food, the ambiance and the service were all phenomenal. The food quality was fresh and extremely flavorful. We ordered a portion of their homemade biscuits and mimosas to start off. My husband then ordered brioche French Toast, which was to die for! I ordered their eggs Benedict with a side of fruit. The food was so good that we returned for dinner the same day.

Went here for dinner. Ordered their Glazed Cedar Plank Salmon, "Our Best Veggie Burger", Mac n' Cheese with chicken and Butterscotch Bread Pudding. To wash it down, I also got the Victory Golden Monkey. Everything was beautiful. The salmon was perfectly done and so were the mashed potatoes that accompanied it. The fries with the burger were fresh and so was the pasta. The pudding was rich and tasted awesome!

Will come back here again for sure.

This was my first time at the Dupon Circle location and I went for the White Truffle Menu Fine Dining Experience.  The food was Hella yummy (the shroom burger is the best!) And the service was extra awesome! There was a "fine dining" white linen tablecloth Experience to roll out the white truffle menu. It was fantastic and I'm extremely glad that I went! Go there. The food is yummy and the people are great

Tried my old favorite for the first time in more than 10 years. It was crowded with young people and the wait was relatively long. The patty was a bit burnt and less juicy than it used be. It used to be that with each bite into the burger, flavor of meat spread throughout the mouth. But this time around it was less satisfying.

I came two days ago and them burgers were hitting so good & the workers were so nice and patient. I just seen them other reviews like no this is a 5 star experience I had, like how can milkshake even be melted? Yes I’m throwing shade. These workers need a raise idc!! They working their a$$ off !!!!
Not your typical fast food resturant.  It's definitely a step above that.  Food was good and fresh to order.  Kinda expensive but that seems to be how things are nowadays.
It is always busy at this location. My order takes about 25 minutes. The shroom burger is good.

My chicken bento box was really good. The sushi rolls was more like 4/5 stars for me (it could be just that little bit fresher IMO even though there’s nothing wrong with the quality). The service was excellent. If it was just $5 - 7 less per pax for the meal, the value would have been excellent. I am rating it 5 stars even though 4.5 stars is what I would have rated.

Good sushi, true to traditional style. Grilled octopus was also excellent
Had to order uni separately because it was not included in any set menu

The service here was absolutely perfect. They were all so kind and even put a candle on the dessert for my friend's birthday. And the food is delicious!! Lots of options, including vegetarian rolls. We enjoyed our visit here.

The restaurant was super accommodating in moving reservations when I called that same day. Ordered the special clam miso soup, seaweed salad (could be shared between 2 people), sashimi moriawase, and a spicy tuna roll. The host was aware it was my brother’s birthday and even sent over a beautiful, complimentary green tiramisu sponge! A delicious, super satisfying meal with a beautiful ambiance that would be great for dining in! All waiters were in masks and tables were distanced enough from each other. Highly recommend!
Great quality, recommend the KAZ Tasting 0011 & just keep the experience going until you're done.   Service is pretty slow, at least when we were there but we got what we came for in the end.

The food is delicious, the place is decorated beautiful with Christmas decorations besides its classy and upscale look. Wasn't able to try a drink I was recommended to try by the server but overall great experience. Place is located in a great location which is great if your wanting to get great photos with friends/family. Parking Garage is 2 minutes away in walking distance to this restaurant which is very convenient. 👍🏾

Amazing customer service! The outdoor dining is just soo extremely gorgeous, spacious and clean in every way. You have a lovely view of the water, the Sweden Embassy, and just the river! The food was just next level, specially the octopus that was cooked to perfection and I will certainly have it again when I come back to bring my boyfriend.

The Best Sunday Brunch in the DMV area hands down! Omelette Station, Chicken and Waffles, Crab Cakes made on the spot, Cheese Grits, Bacon, Salmon, Crab Legs, Salads, Milkshake, Bottomless Mimosas.... on and on! This is not your regular buffet. There is a 2 hour time limit and it is a bit pricey, about $100pp, but definitely worth it! The only negative I had was the Crab Legs were not seasoned and cold (over ice). This place is a must try. The atmosphere is amazing as well.

First off, I'm thrilled they are open again! The outdoor dining is amazing.  I had the best fried calamari I've had in years. They have a new fresh juice drink menu from the bar that was delicious. My only issue is the new decor inside is a bit odd. It was always such a beautiful, classically designed restaurant which looks like someone got happy with bright colors from the 80s on the walls. I'm not sure what is up with that?  Since the bones are still elegant and classic, hopefully they will paint the walls and remove some odd lights or artwork to get back to the original place.

Very disappointing. Location is spectacular. Food was very subpar. The crab cakes in particular were so disappointing. According to a server there was cayenne pepper in the crab cakes that's their words not mine when we asked about the spice and it was so overwhelming it ruined a great lump crab cake. No filler at all. All crab meat but it was way beyond spicy to enjoy. Also....french fries with crab cakes? Odd. The short ribs were good in spots but also dry too dry to enjoy. Overall it was an underwhelming meal at an above average price point. Plenty of other places to go and try around here.

One of the best (and priciest) places to grab lunch in Foggy Bottom. The sandwiches are pre-made but fresh and delicious. Soup and salad options are really. Fast and friendly service. I will be returning often!

Very friendly people serving up very delicious food! Great spot to get a smoothie, sandwich,
salad or pastry. Very close to George Washington University and the Foggy Bottom train station.
There was a wide variety of soups and you could taste a sample before deciding. The staff are really friendly.

I had a simple breakfast. Cheese eggs and potatoes. The eggs were a bit runny but was okay. Potatoes were good. I'm giving 5 stars because of the staff. All were super friendly. And it seems they take pride in their work. Even the person just sticking the waters, cokes, etc made sure all were faced the same way and in perfect order. Watching the bakers, it looked like they were taking care when prepping. Give them a try!

Great deli for grab and go! Everything was so fresh. The size of each sandwich is larger than usual, you definitely get your money worth it. The set up was very clean, roomy and organize. Love this place!

Both the breakfast and dinner were excellent. While we regrettably had to cancel our dinner reservation one night, they allow for you to order via room service, which we opted to do instead. It arrived quickly and piping hot. The crab cakes were delicious, as was the braised beef rib. We regrettably didn't get any pictures of those because we ate them too quickly! When we did eat in the restaurant, the staff were all very friendly and provided quick, attentive service. I have heard their brunch is great, we will have to stop by and check it out!

Came to DC for the cherry blossoms and to celebrate our anniversary. So glad we were able to get a reservation on a Saturday night. We loved everything we ordered, the beef rib was so flavorful but tender, the striped bass is light but fresh and the texture of the fish was so soft, the side order of cauliflower has great flavor and with a crispy outside, almost greens beans blended really well with the mushroom.
We also got an apple pie as dessert, the pie crust is extremely thin but flaky, the apple filling is tangy but remains a very good texture (not overly soft). We couldn't finish it so took it back to our hotel and ate it the next morning, it still tasted really good!
The whole experience sitting right in front of the open kitchen was really cool, we were able to see the chef dedicatedly finishing every dish before serving it. We really enjoyed our visit at the Blue Duck Tavern and we're impressed by the quality of each dish here.

Absolutely phenomenal. This place has the best duck ever. Honestly, everything we had was amazing--from the charcuterie board to the horseradish potatoes to the chocolate peanut butter cake. A well-rounded meal. Not to mention, our waiter did an excellent job at recommending our wine selection and paired beautifully with our dishes. Just an amazing experience and will come back when we are in the city again.

Five-star all the way. Service, cuisine, ambiance. Just a really nice fine dining experience. My husband was there to celebrate becoming a citizen and our server was so sweet and told us about his becoming a citizen years earlier. He took such good care of us, we were just in Heaven from start to finish. Can’t wait to return!

Blue Duck Tavern in the Park Hyatt is an amazing dining experience. The ambience and the service match the excellent cocktails, wine, and cuisine. You truly get what you pay for and you do pay don’t get me wrong but WoW everything tastes excellent and the service team’s attention to detail elevates the experience. The bone marrow and the duck were my favourite dishes to name a couple. Intriguingly delicious was their house bread with olives! Excellent dining experience that is worth the price. Cheers.

Went to this establishment for a dinner with friends from work.  my first time in D.C.  The food and atmosphere were great.  Everything tasted fresh.  Service was friendly and accommodating.  I would definitely come back and try another dish.  Only reason I can't give 5 stars is the drinks were not the best.

I was visiting DC and so many people recommended this restaurant as a must try. It was a little hard to get a reservation when I navigated their site but luckily on my last night in DC, a friend called them and we were able to get a table. This food is by far one of the best Indian foods I have had (besides in India). Their food was actually spicy and so flavorful. I highly recommend trying their paneer. It was my favorite appetizer there.

Great food and they made accomodations for me as a vegan. I was dining here with a reservation group of 10 people, and I was the only vegan. When we were being seated, they asked if there were any dietary restrictions, so during each meal course they would bring a modified version without the yogurt or dairy additives for me, and they brought out house made sorbet for me for dessert.

Highly recommend.
This might have literally been the best meal I've ever had. The food was absolutely amazing, as was the service. Everything was just lovely. Thank you for a wonderful meal and a fantastic time!

Sat at the bar and ordered a bunch of appetizers and drinks. The fried cauliflower dipped in the tiki marsla sauce was amazing and the crispy spinach was some new and delightful. What stole the show was the rice pudding made with black rice.... it was by far the best rice pudding I have ever had!

It’s a lovely little bar down the street that we reside in. We have always been wanting to go there to try out the food there as it is always a bustling place filled with students from GW university mostly. We finally found a day to make it happen. I ordered the buffalo chicken tots and my husband ordered Egg Benedict. The food was good and it came with a generous amount of the crispy tots. Ambience was good as it’s always bustling with kids and there’s live music and happy hours to make the place all the more happening. Overall, a good hangout spot for a chilled weekend or a boring weekday to liven up the mood with finger food.

Atmosphere was down to earth, low key and very enjoyable.  Food was delicious. I had their famous tater tots but u wasn't a fan of the Buffalo sauce they used.  The burger I had was fantastic, piled high with pulled pork that was juicy and delicious.  The pictures don't lie!

Good food and great service.  It got crowded at lunchtime, but there's seating upstairs, downstairs, and outside.  The Foggy Bottom Fried Chicken Sandwich was huge and there was a plateful of tater tots, their specialty.  The perfect place to have lunch before or after visiting the nearby Textile Museum.

Came here for brunch with a friend and loved it! Did bottomless mimosas and a meal and the prices were great! Loved the food & atmosphere. It was our waitress’s first day and she was great. We’ll definitely be back!

Wonderful place to grab a quick bite or sit down for dinner. Outside patio is heated. Food was delightful! We had the sheet pan nachos and we could have fed 4 comfortably. It may have been a while bag of chips! (we had already had quite a bit when this picture was taken!) Highly recommend this place!

I really liked the restaurant and its vibe. The service was great and fast. Our waitress, she was amazing. Drinks were tasty and interesting. We didn’t like the Brussel sprout at all so we didn’t touch it, and we didn’t say anything. However our waitress realized it and she was kind enough to suggest and change it for us. We got the caesar salad instead which was amazing!! For main course we ordered the dry aged bon in steak 18 oz to share. it was really tasty and good. However part of my steak was burnt ( we ordered medium, which was really good medium) but not sure why part of was burnt! Also since we wanted to share they cut it for us in advance and put their full butter on Top for each of us which was too much butter for half steak. At the end i wish it wasn’t burnt on outside (part of it) and i wish was less buttery. Still tasty though. Not to mention the lava cake was good too.
Note 1. I didn’t know my plate is too hot so I touched it to move it and burned my finger! I wish they told me it was hot.
Note 2. If you rely on google map to find it remember it is inside the building on the second floor. So don’t walk around wondering.

If you're on a budget, this isn't the place for you.  Online menus haven't been updated since before COVID and the reasonably priced lunch specials are no longer available.   I was so disappointed because both the Crispy Chicken BLT and Prime Burger looked so good.

Made a reservation and arrived 30 mins early. We were promptly seated with no issues and greeted by Jerry, whom is probably the most professional waiter I've ever had! He gave honest suggestions and we ended up with the filet mignon and wagyu filet with brussel sprouts and sour cream mashed potatoes. Drinks were on point! Highly recommend the lemon drop martini and old fashioned, you can't go wrong! I thank you for the outstanding service, you will see us again!

Very average dining experience. Food was okay. Ambiance was good. Service was good. Nothing spectacular, but good. Parking wasn't easy to find, but we finally realized that there was a parking lot across the street. Also it's on the second floor of the business building, not very visible from the outside.

WOW. I feel spoiled. Thank you. Enjoyed every bite. As it should be. We had a great time. Oysters, two different salads, crab cakes, waygu steak.  Perfectly prepared.
Robin the manager was very accommodating and welcoming.
Special place for a special time or just anytime.

name: Farmers Fishers Bakers
vicinity: Harbour at The Georgetown Waterfront, 3000 K St NW, The Washington, Washington

reviews.text: This is a great place for tasty, creative food, and delicious cocktail. They feature many different house-made drinks and locally sourced ingredients. We went at 6:00 on a Thursday evening for a nice dinner before hitting a 7:30 show at the Kennedy Center. We made a reservation (for 2) but probably didn't need it, although the place was reasonably full when we arrived. I'd still recommend reservations just to be safe. They have a wide variety of entrees that should be able to accommodate most eating preferences. Everything we had was excellent quality and prepared perfectly. Note - we ordered one app, two entrees, and three cocktails and our bill came to $150 including tax&tip.

Loved loved loved the menu! So many options from purple & Black salads, Bacon onion blue cheese burgers, and spicy tuna rolls to chicken and waffles, garlic black pepper wings, and calamari pizzas. The popcorn we ordered was delicious (a little burnt at the bottom), but the rest of it was fun and tasty! I ordered the cedar plank salmon and the sauce was AMAZING! The fish was nice and soft, but not mushy at all. The green beans were also cooked to perfection. The other people I went with also enjoyed their meals. While we didn’t order dessert, we really should have! Our neighbors ordered dessert and it looked sooooooo good!

The service from the hostess to the servers was beyond exceptional. They were willing to clear tables that they weren't serving. We asked a different server for a to go box...she took our dirty plates and brought us boxes back to pack our food (She didn't just pass it our server.) Food was good. Chocolate chip cookies were 🔥. Great atmosphere. Worth it for the time it takes to prepare scratch food. The Fishers Fryer and Bourbon Sour in the picture.

The place was busy definitely a locally loved spot. Personally the cheaper of a lot of the restaurants without risking quality at all . I had the grilled cheese burger and it was immaculate. My drink was made by our server/bartender Mateo, it was not only absolutely gorgeous but got me feeling just right. He was attentive and helpful, and also helped me with my drink request. Definitely not a disappointment and worth taking a trip to!

Big letdown. Everything about this place looks cool, but the food is not worth the price. Got the fried chicken jambalaya and it came with a salad on top. The salad was gross. The chicken was a thigh and a breast, but it had the bones in. You hardly get any meat and it is difficult to eat. It was the same with the chicken and waffles. The chicken was the same way with bones. The green beans were blah and the meal came with a lemon sauce, which is weird.

The drinks were pretty good because they make their own spirits. The waitstaff was very nice, but if you have allergies don’t bother coming here. Everything has peppers and there is not much that can be made. They tried, but at least they do say that on their website. The restaurant recovery fee is bogus and 5%. They must need a lot of recovery.

Final score: 2.3

There are better ways to spend $100. Come here for drinks, not food.

Great service from Aaron and the entire waitstaff was pleasant and attentive. The steak, duck fries and Cocktails were superb; the shrimp cocktail was good, but a bit overcooked prior to chilling. I would pass on the Mac and cheese. I would definitely return in the future for other menu options and the ambiance.

Great steak and the sides like the truffle macaroni and cheese as well as the asparagus were perfect compliments. Expect to pay the price for the food you'll get here, but worth it if you're looking for a good cut of steak. The service was also very friendly and patient with our group while we met with customers. The only thing I feel they could improve would be the atmosphere. Seems a tad dated, but overall great location being in Georgetown. Also though, that means you'll want to come on a weeknight for parking close by, valet, or ride-share.

Booked one of the private chalets for Valentine's Day and it was amazing! The service was the best we've ever had, and what you would expect from a restaurant during the four seasons. The food was delectable, flavorful, and well proportioned especially for the many courses we had. Had. They have an amazing wine selection. This is definitely an experience you and your significant other will enjoy. And I don't even see a problem with somebody booking it for a group of four as well for a really cool double date.

I would have liked to give this place more stars, but a few hiccups left me no choice, but give them a solid 3.5 stars

We were really exited in celebrating my husband's birthday with our children here. It's the first family trip and celebration in a restaurant since the pandemic.

First, the atmosphere was great and the food would have been perfect if they were not bland, where we were expecting more flavors and too salty in other areas.

We appreciate how family friendly it was! They have kids menu, but I can't recall the age limit. We were warmly greeted and I thought were off on a great note.

The main server was nice and gave recommendations, but only when asked. He did not take initiative so it was a bit odd for us. The assisting servers, on the other hand, were awesome! They were very attentive (ie. Refilling glasses before it ever went empty and paying attention that I was still on sparkling water and great with the kids).

Speaking of sparkling water.... I've never been to a place that up charged it for about 1000%; no exaggeration. It was $11 for a bottle. My husband enjoyed the "marry me honey" drink before the meal and the red wine with the steak.

I have to agree the fries were delicious! It was odd that we were not offered the garlic bread. I wouldn't have known that we could have some until I saw other tables served them and thought it was odd to have a bread plate, but not offered bread. It was only when I asked one of the assisting servers that we were served since bread, which my husband enjoyed. I, on the other hand, found that it wasn't great. I thought the idea was neat, but it was not soft as I thought it would be (like a cinnamon roll).

The table side preparation of the tuna tartare was a nice touch and it looked elegant prior to being mixed. We both felt it was underseasoned and could use a touch of citrus.

I enjoyed the brussel sprouts side. The mushrooms were salty though. We requested the rib eye to be cooked medium rare, but my husband found it more rare than he'd like. The steak was also salty. The kids' meals look good, but the farmer's fruit platter appetizer for the kids looked very plain and lacked finesse. The kids did mention that the Mac and cheese was not as good as how I make it at home. Because it was considered a must try fish, we tried a bit and agreed it was really one note and tasted heavy.

Lastly, when I called to make reservations, I mentioned it was my husband's birthday. Someone called to confirm our reservations and his birthday and said they will make it extra special for him. We weren't expecting much, but not even a candle on the chocolate molten lava cake. We should have tried with the s'mores other Yelpers recommended as the molten lava cake was a disappointment. Not really molten and nothing spectacular.

My brother celebrated his birthday at Bourbon Steak. With the help of Jose and Dillon I was able to coordinate a bourbon flight experience for him to enjoy. I highly recommend this establishment. With Dillon and Jose’s help you will not be disappointed with the experience and service you will receive at Bourbon Steak.

Went to this beautiful place for brunch on a Sunday. The food was a whole new level of excitement! Presentation and quality of the food and the good ambience set the right tone for the weekend. But the only setback was the price. We had an Egg frittata, chicken and waffles and Egg Benedict-crab ( the chef special) and it cost us 70$. A great place to grab finger food in a cute setting !

Easy to find the place but parking will be tricky in the area. Give yourself some time to find it ahead of the reservation.
It is good to have reservations, if not there will be accommodation for walk-ins during non-peak hours.
Ambiance is nice, seats are well cushioned, tables heights are decent but atmosphere is slightly noisier.
Staff and service is excellent. Food is decent, the taste won’t wow you but cooking methods and attention to details is good definitely noticeable. Overall it will leave you satisfied.
Breakfast menu will be available earlier in the morning. Brunch tentatively starts around 10-10.30am.
Signature cocktail are decent but Great-great coffee. Everything on the morning fuel is excellent. I liked the espresso martini the most.
Brioche French toast toast nice but I was slightly surprised by the value proposition of this dish. Corned beef hash, firefly burger, eggs Benedict, all are nice. I really liked the way they cooked eggs to perfection in Benedict. Sides are good.
A good experience overall but only coffee will drive me to visit it again.

Excellent breakfast spot. Indoor and outdoor seating available. Parking is pretty scarce around the area. Staff is excellent. Good is delicious. Music is diverse. Location is convenient. This is going to be one of my new favorite breakfast spots.

Wonderful location and the food is pretty good.  The prices are very high.
Brunch for two with no drinks besides one cup of black coffee was $50 for one order of French Toast, one Avocado Toast, and a side of fruit.

The service was good overall, but one small thing annoyed me somewhat.  We were there for Saturday brunch so I ordered a cup of black coffee right when the waitress first came over.  The coffee, which they charged $5 for, finally came a minute before our food.  I drank it quickly, thinking that for $5 for a tiny cup, a refill would be in order.  No such luck.  I don't know if asking for a refill would have taken another 20 minutes and cost another $5, but at that point in the meal, I didn't bother.

Overall, a solid 5-stars.  The location and ambiance outside are really great.

The food and atmosphere here was absolutely amazing! I was blown away by the avocado eggs Benedict. The one thing I would say is my server was ehhh… He genuinely lacked a personality and was practically non existant during our time there. Other than that, I will definitely be back!!

Visited on Sunday around 6pm. Surprisingly not busy at all! Great atmosphere with holiday decorations for meeting friends and having a conversation (we stopped by another place that had terribly loud music and was crowded.

Food we ordered was very good. I would rate it 5. Only minus, wished to have more choices  and desserts. But it was a great basic menu and everything tested great. Service was perfect. Quick and nice. Staff came regularly to ask whether we needed anything else.

Chill old school bar near the white house... Great selection of beers, and the bar food was decent. The barman was very chill and kept checking up on me quite a bit. The crowd was pretty respectful as well. They had soccer playing on the big screen behind the bar, which is rare but nice!

Really great burgers, salads, wraps and sandwiches at a reasonable price.
They have an awesome collection of beers as well.
Highly recommend a visit.

Ordered a "best voted cheeseburger" and good lord was it ever bland. Have they heard of seasoning? The service was good they acknowledged that we didn't eat the food, and did nothing about it. Chicken was dry. Don't do it.

Another fantastic DC underground dive. The bartenders are the real treat here. Charisma all around from Chuck and the gang. Long bar - space for everyone. Friendly locals. Good burgers. Jukebox. I would absolutely come back. Definitely worthy to be one of Eaters top 15 most lovable DC dives. I’ll be recommending it to anyone I know headed to DC.

Went here for one of my many birthday dinners. As a new vegetarian this place definitely had a menu with me in mind. I was stuffed when I left. We had the menu with five courses and enjoyed every single one of them. Amazing. Would definitely go again, don’t know the price because i didn’t pay.  😇

Overall it was a great dining experience. The restaurant wasn't overly loud and it had an intimate vibe. We felt secluded enough in our table. The service was a bit slow to start, we waited over 20 min just to get our drink orders in. But then it picked up and we got our 5 course sampler and it was great. Some of the best food I've had.

We came for restaurant week and it was a great deal! Loved the plant based options. We had to wait 15 min for our table after we arrived on time for our reservation but it was worth it once we were seated. The mushroom dish was delicious and the portions for all courses were huge. Definitely ended the meal full and satisfied.

This place has been on my must try restaurants list forever, and finally made it on my birthday. We tried the five course meal. While each dish was carefully thought through and well presented, I think the beet salad didn’t really work (it was bitter) and grilled eggplant was a bit bland. Though I don’t typically enjoy mushrooms as much, I was blown by the Hen of mushrooms dish, and absolute winner. Overall, I would recommend this place!

I was there for a celebration and had a wonderful time and a wonderful meal. My appetizer was shrimp & grits. The main course was a filet. Desert was a yummy molasses cake with ice cream. It was all so delicious!!

This was our first time dinning at the Roof Terrace before attending a show downstairs and I would have to say we really enjoyed our visit.

This is the perfect place for a nice romantic dinner date the ambiance and views are absolutely amazing and the foods not bad either🤣🤣🤣

Although it was a little pricey it was still worth the price of admission.  I was told that their Sunday brunch is amazing and I can’t wait to experience that next.

So once again if your looking to enjoy a nice dinner and a show at The Kennedy Center the Roof Terrace is the spot!!

RTR is a pretty good place for dinner before a show at the Kennedy Center. The restaurant has the classic aesthetic of the Kennedy Center with beautiful views from the terrace outside the restaurant. The staff were friendly enough though our waiter didn't talk with us too much. Food service was quick which is to be expected for those going to performances. The quality of the food is okay. All of our entrees were hot but just okay taste wise. Pretty good selection for vegetarians and the fish choices are nice too! We'll come back and try it again as we go to the KC often.

A solid experience one would expect from a prestigious venue like The Kennedy Center. Tremendous ambiance and service. The views from up there are spectacular and enrich the experience of an evening outing. The food was delicious, but not really stand out exceptional. Overall with everything considered, an incredible place that's perfect for a date night.

I have never been to the Kennedy Center and had no idea that there even was a restaurant. What a very nice dining experience. Santo our waiter was very knowledgeable with the food and drinks. It is a bit pricey but worth it. Even if you are not going to an event I highly recommend checking it out.

My husband and I visited the Kennedy Center last night to tour the new JFK exhibit, dine at the Roof Terrace and watched Wicked.  We had an amazing time.  The new exhibit is a great way to immerse yourself in all the aspects surrounding the creation of the National Cultural Center and the role the Kennedys played to make it a reality, which of course, contributed to the re-designation as the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.  The Roof Terrace is a very nice restaurant with the most friendly staff and an amazing view of the DC and Virginia skylines.  The only downside is the food is overpriced, in my opinion, for what you receive. The steak I ordered was really good and the lobster mac and cheese definitely did not skimp on the lobster.  The rest of our meal was good, but not at a level commensurate with the price.  You are definitely paying for the location; so just understand that going in.  I would like to re-state the staff were all very welcoming and made sure we had everything we needed.  There is a full bar, beer, and wine available.  The selection was a little small, but diverse.  One other tip, reservations are pretty much a must.  I made a reservation as soon as I purchased tickets for a show, so it was months in advance and I did not have any issues with availablility.  I have tried to make a reservation a week out before and it was booked solid; so just somethingto considerin advance of your visit.  Thank you again for another great evening enjoying the arts in our nation's capital.

Extraordinary!!  and I do not exaggerate what I say.  the dough is absolutely perfect, the ingredients fresh and top quality.  The spotless place very clean and the staff very attentive and cheerful.  It opens until 2am which is very convenient for those of us who arrive late at the hotel.

Pretty decent pizza! Especially if you order by the slice and have them stick it back in the oven for a little extra time so the cheese gets melty. Stopped in for a couple quick slices. They are BIG slices which is awesome. Came out hot with a pretty decent crusty crust. Would definately try a slice if you are looking for some hot pizza.

Some indoor seating with tables or take to-go.

I'm from NYC and this is the worst pizza I've ever had. Rather than slices from jumbo sized pizza pies, they just cut regular sized pizza pies into 4 slices instead of 8. That said, the $6 price is alright given you essentially get 2 slices in 1. However, it tastes horrible. It doesn't even taste cheap. It just tastes wrong. I don't know how to explain it. I'm not trying to sound picky but this was the first time I've thrown out food in years.
This pizza is huge!! I got two slices thinking they would be normal sizes and they had to slice them for me into four! And it was also delicious. I’m definitely coming back!

(updated: Standing in line and watching the counter attendant actively discriminate.) Never saw this behavior again. They have a sign posted at the front ALL are welcome. Best slice in DC for a couple reasons. $5 for basically two slices. But it's also thin crust, flavorful dough, good cheese. It doesn't need much else made this way. I'm glad they got their lives.

name: Così
vicinity: The Barr Building, 910 17th Street Northwest, Washington

reviews.text:
So glad they are back! It was the best salad and prepared perfectly! SO YUMMY!🥗

The staff was super nice and kind and the ambience there is lovely… you can really enjoy your meal.

Definitely plan on going there again and again….

It’s going to definitely be my new salad spot.
Excellent selection of soups, sandwiches, pizza and salads. You can choose two, like a cup of soup and half a sandwich, for a very reasonable price. Service and food were both very good.

The Signature Salad is one of my favorite salads and this visit did not disappoint. The server was friendly and made a fresh salad for me. Cosi has closed locations in my hometown so I enjoy it when I travel.
Stood at the counter for 10 mins trying to find someone to sell me a salad but no one helped me.  Ended up walking out. Used to love Cosi in the old days.
Wow...That is the word to describe this wonderful place and it's ever helpful staff. Good place to eat and well located

The decor, ambience and customer service are outstanding. We chose the bottomless brunch (food only) and it was good, but none of the options stood out to us. I appreciated that for the bottomless we were told in advance that portions were smaller.  The smaller portions were easily shareable which we chose to do so that we could enjoy more options. It was good to try and would be nice for large groups.

Finally made it for brunch here. I've been wanting to check it out for a while. More of a fine dining experience. Less laid back. Appears that customer service is prized very high here. Food was good - smaller servings than necessary. Nice ambience.

Fantastic service and a nicely designed setting made our visit memorable. The menu is somewhat limited, but the food was delicious and beautifully pretended. Would like to see more appetizers that are less like side dishes you'd have with dinner. The ladies bathroom gave me a couple of chuckles.

Food was really good but pricey. They do have unlimited mimosas if you do the all you can eat which is $50 per person. The portions as small buy again its all you can eat. The chicken and waffles was amazing, they have a waffles station, omelet station.

I came here for the Christmas dinner. I’m giving it a 3 because the service was good. Unfortunately the food was mediocre and extremely overpriced. $70 buffet style. The meat was absolutely dry and tasteless. I tried both the salmon and chicken , but couldn’t bare to eat either. The sides were good but not worth $70.  I don’t think I’ll ever have this type of dining experience over the holidays. I will cook my own.
